page.title: 20Wem Amateur Dramatic Society
page.content: 1919 was the year when the Amdrams put on their first production, an operetta, and they have continued ever since apart from the war years. The number of shows is about 4 a year and they try to have a wide variety, something for everyone. Every year they enter a play in a local drama festival, often with great success. The society is run by a committee who choose and organise the productions. Besides the cast, which varies from 4 to 24, there are always many others involved with lighting, music, scenery props and costumesetc. Because there is such a range ofjobs, the society involves a cross section of the people in Wem and everyone is always welcome to join in. The Town Hall is usually full because the Amdrams have built up such a good reputation. Wem is lucky to have such a thriving group in town.
